meanings.sent1: I saw the opportunity and decided to snab it before anyone else could.
meanings.sent2: She tried to snab the last cookie from the jar before her brother could get it.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel managed to snab the nut right from under the bird's beak.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to snab the coin out of thin air during his trick.
meanings.sent5: The cat was able to snab the toy mouse with lightning speed.

meanings.definition: A sudden or unexpected attack or seizure
meanings.sent1: The soldier launched a snab on the enemy camp under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: The surprise snab by the pirates caught the villagers off guard.
meanings.sent3: The ninja's snab on the treasure chest was swift and silent.
meanings.sent4: The sudden snab of the spotlight by the young singer stunned the audience.
meanings.sent5: The hawk's snab on the mouse was quick and precise.

meanings.definition: To catch or take quickly and unexpectedly
meanings.sent1: The goalkeeper managed to snab the ball just before it crossed the goal line.
meanings.sent2: She tried to snab a glimpse of the surprise gift before it was wrapped.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was able to snab the grapes from the vine without being noticed.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket attempted to snab the wallet from the distracted tourist.
meanings.sent5: The student tried to snab a seat in the front row before the lecture started.
